result.execSummary:
The defendant Shane C. Deinlein was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).
  • Failure to Support Child (<120 Days) [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 1 YEAR in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges and places the Defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment
--Comply with ALL family court orders regarding child support
--Make all child support payment on time
--Make all payments on arrearages according to any child support orders
--Within 5 days of sentencing (or if confined, within 5 business days of release from custody), defendant shall report to the child support agency - Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Ave. Jefferson Rm219, to complete a case management meeting
--Advise child support office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such a change
--Not leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval
--All payments towards child support and arrearages are to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, PO Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 not through DOC

Arresting Agency:  Jefferson County Child Support Services

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

[MK] cases #12CF297, #12CF381, #14CF342, and #16CF491 called at 10:51am.
Defendant Shane C. Deinlein in court, in custody, with Attorney Shaun W O'Connell.  ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Sentencing arguments are given by ADA Shock.
Attorney O'Connell submits a letter from Mr. Deinlein's spouse. 
A statement is given by Mr. Deinlein's mother, Julie Clementi.   
Sentencing arguments are given by Attorney O'Connell.
Recess 11:18am, Reconvene 11:22am.
Further sentencing arguments given by Attorney O'Connell. 
Statement made by Mr. Deinlein.


On Case #14CF342-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to  2 years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is to commence forthwith, concurrent with the jail sentence Mr. Deinlein is presently serving on Count #1.
The Court gives 175 days credit for time already served.
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court indicates that its intent is that Mr. Deinlein is to undergo mental health treatment and AODA assessment and treatment while in Prison. 
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid court financial obligations. 
-----------------------------------------------

On Case #12CF297-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to 2 years and 6 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 18 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is consecutive to Case #14CF342.
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court indicates that its intent is that Mr. Deinlein is to undergo mental health treatment and AODA assessment and treatment while in Prison. 

On Case #12CF297-Count #3 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to 6 months in Jail [to be served in the Prison System] concurrent with Count #1.   

The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid court financial obligations. 
The Court gives 181 days credit for time already served.
-----------------------------------------------

On Case #12CF381-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to 6 months in Jail [to be served in the Prison System].  This sentence is a concurrent sentence.
The Court gives 4 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for unpaid court financial obligations. 
------------------------------------------------

On Case #16CF491-Count #1 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to  2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year.  This sentence is consecutive to #14CF342 and #12CF297 and #12CF381.

On Case #16CF491-Count #2 the Court sentences Mr. Deinlein to 2  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  1  year, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1  year.  This sentence is concurrent to Count #1
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that Mr. Deinlein is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court indicates that its intent is that Mr. Deinlein is to undergo mental health treatment and AODA assessment and treatment while in Prison. 
Days credit for time served:  0 days 

On all of the Extended Supervision terms the Court orders conditions of Extended Supervision as those set forth on the "Criminal Case Settlement" form in Case #16CF491 [which are: 
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--to undergo any assessment, treatment, or counseling per Agent
--to maintain absolute sobriety: no alcohol; no controlled substances without a prescription; to take all prescription drugs as prescribed
--to obtain/maintain employment or education program per Agent
--to comply with all Family Court orders regarding child support
--to make all child support payments on time
--to make all payments on arrearages according to the child support orders
--within five days of of release from incarceration, Mr. Deinlein shall report to the Child Support Agency, Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Avenue, Jefferson, Room 219, to complete a case management meeting
--to advise the Child Support Office of any employment or address-change within 48 hours of such a change
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval
--all payments toward child support and arrearages are to be paid through the Wisconsin Support Collection Trust Fund (Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200), and not through the Department of Corrections
--DNA sample provision]

The Court orders entry of a civil judgment for court costs and surcharges including the DNA surcharge [per the Criminal Case Settlement this is to include extradition fees, if any, once known.]

Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
recess 12:02pm.

Case called at 10:34 am [Clerk SH]
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Defendant Shane C. Deinlein in court with Attorney Yelena Olegovna Zarwell. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall orally motions to AMEND the complaint: - Court accepts amendment
Count #1-Failure toSupport, Repeater
The defendant on/between August 1, 2013 and November 30, 2013, in the City of Jefferson, Jefferson County, Wisconsin, did intentionally fail to provide child support for less than 120 consecutive days, where he knew he is legally obligated to pay said support, contrary to sec. 948.22(3), 939.62(1)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor, and upon conviction may be fined not more than Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000), or imprisoned not more than nine (9) months, or both. 

And further, invoking the provisions of sec. 939.62(1)(a) Wis. Stats., because the defendant is a repeater, having been convicted of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to sec. 946.49(1)(b), Wis. Stats., a Class H Felony on December 18, 2012 in Jefferson County Case No. 2012CF381 during the five year period immediately preceding the commission of this offense, which conviction(s) remain of record and unreversed, the maximum term of imprisonment for the underlying crime may be increased to not more than 2 years.

Count #2-Failure to Support, Repeater
The above-named defendant/between December 1, 2013 and March 31, 2014, in the City of Jefferson, Jefferson County, Wisconsin, did intentionally fail to provide child support for less than 120 consecutive days, where he knew he is legally obligated to pay said support, contrary to sec. 948.22(3), 939.62(1)(a) Wis. Stats., a Class A Misdemeanor, and upon conviction may be fined not more than Ten Thousand Dollars ($10,000), or imprisoned not more than nine (9) months, or both. 

And further, invoking the provisions of sec. 939.62(1)(a) Wis. Stats., because the defendant is a repeater, having been convicted of Felony Bail Jumping, contrary to sec. 946.49(1)(b), Wis. Stats., a Class H Felony on December 18, 2012 in Jefferson County Case No. 2012CF381 during the five year period immediately preceding the commission of this offense, which conviction(s) remain of record and unreversed, the maximum term of imprisonment for the underlying crime may be increased to not more than 2 years.       ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________
Upon questioning of Counsel, Atty Zarwell indicates that the waiver of prelim. paperwork was submitted in error

Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 1 YEAR in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges and places the Defendant on probation for 2 years, concurrent, with conditions:

On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, places Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count, concurrent, with conditions:
--To undergo any assessment, treatment or counseling as required per Agent
--To maintain employment
--Comply with ALL family court orders regarding child support
--Make all child support payment on time
--Make all payments on arrearages according to any child support orders
--Within 5 days of sentencing (or if confined, within 5 business days of release from custody), defendant shall report to the child support agency - Jefferson County Courthouse, 311 S. Center Ave. Jefferson Rm219, to complete a case management meeting
--Advise child support office of any employment or address change within 48 hours of such a change
--To pay $486 costs ($243 each count)
--To pay $400 DNA Surcharge ($200 each count)
--Not leave the State of Wisconsin without court approval
--All payments towards child support and arrearages are to be paid through: WISCONSIN SUPPORT COLLECTION TRUST FUND, PO Box 74200, Milwaukee WI 53274-0200 not through DOC


Days credit for time already served: 0 days
Recess: 11:00 am
Defendant's
